alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 3:36AM CST until February 11 at 4:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Period of Snow This Evening With Slick Travel... A fast-moving storm system will bring a period of accumulating snow late this afternoon into this evening. The heaviest snow will likely occur for around 2 to 3 hours this evening with rates up to 1/2 to 1 inch per hour during this time. The snow will diminish by late evening, but light snow or patchy freezing drizzle could linger into the early morning. If traveling late today or tonight, be prepared for wintry driving conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor County. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
